description: Ms. codex. Title from leaf 1a. Physical description: Generally 30 lines per page; written in small, cramped naskh with elements of nastaʻliq in black on glazed, laid European paper. Catchwords. Mild staining and a few repairs. Origin: 23 Muḥarram 1255 H [8 April 1839], by ʻAlī ibn Ḥusayn al-Qazwīnī (leaf 57a). Incipit: الحمد لله الذي اشتق نور الوجود من ظلمة العدم
author: Janājī, Jaʻfar ibn Khaḍir, 1743 or 1744-1811 or 1812
abstract: Commentary on the Kitāb al-muʼāmalāt of Ibn al-Muṭahhar al-Ḥillī's Qawāʻid al-aḥkām fī maʻrifat al-ḥalāl wa-al-ḥarām.
extent: 57 leaves : paper ; 213 x 147 (183 x 124) mm bound to 214 x 155 mm
title: Sharḥ Qawāʻid al-ʻAllāmah al-Ḥillī.
provenance: Owner's note on inner back cover.
creator: جناجي، جعفر بن خضر، 1743 or 1744-1811 or 1812
subject: Ibn al-Muṭahhar al-Ḥillī, al-Ḥasan ibn Yūsuf, 1250-1325—Qawāʻid al-aḥkām fī maʻrifat al-ḥalāl wa-al-ḥarām.
binding note: Limp black leather with blind-stamped central floral design, pendants, and fillets; blue paper doublures.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
